segment.source: Configuring Certificates to Support the App-V Web Management Service
segment.target: Configuring Certificates to Support the App-V Web Management Service

segment.source: Configuring Certificates to Support the App-V Web Management Service
segment.target: Configuring Certificates to Support the App-V Web Management Service

segment.source: Configuring Certificates to Support the App-V Web Management Service
segment.target: Configuring Certificates to Support the App-V Web Management Service

segment.source: The App-V Web Management Service must be configured to support SSL-based connections to help secure the communication.
segment.target: The App-V Web Management Service must be configured to support SSL-based connections to help secure the communication.

segment.source: This process requires that the Web server or computer on which the Management Service is installed has a certificate issued to the service or computer.
segment.target: This process requires that the Web server or computer on which the Management Service is installed has a certificate issued to the service or computer.

segment.source: The following scenarios illustrate how to obtain a certificate for this purpose:
segment.target: The following scenarios illustrate how to obtain a certificate for this purpose:

segment.source: The company infrastructure already has a public key infrastructure (PKI) in place that automatically issues certificates to computers.
segment.target: The company infrastructure already has a public key infrastructure (PKI) in place that automatically issues certificates to computers.

segment.source: The company infrastructure already has a PKI in place, although it does not automatically issue certificates to computers.
segment.target: The company infrastructure already has a PKI in place, although it does not automatically issue certificates to computers.

segment.source: The company infrastructure has no PKI in place.
segment.target: The company infrastructure has no PKI in place.

segment.source: In each of the preceding scenarios, the method for obtaining a certificate is different, but the end result is the same.
segment.target: In each of the preceding scenarios, the method for obtaining a certificate is different, but the end result is the same.

segment.source: The administrator must assign a certificate to the IIS Default Web Site and configure the App-V Web Management Service to require secure communications.
segment.target: The administrator must assign a certificate to the IIS Default Web Site and configure the App-V Web Management Service to require secure communications.

segment.source: The name of the certificate must match the name of the server.
segment.target: The name of the certificate must match the name of the server.

segment.source: It is a best practice to use fully qualified domain names (FQDNs) for the common name of the certificate.
segment.target: It is a best practice to use fully qualified domain names (FQDNs) for the common name of the certificate.

segment.source: App-V can use IIS servers to support different infrastructure configurations.
segment.target: App-V can use IIS servers to support different infrastructure configurations.

segment.source: For more information about configuring IIS servers to support HTTPS, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=151972.
segment.target: For more information about configuring IIS servers to support HTTPS, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=151972.

segment.source: How to Install and Configure the App-V Management Console for a More Secure Environment
segment.target: How to Install and Configure the App-V Management Console for a More Secure Environment
